model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game handles game play, and contains the players and the communal pile of cards. It is instantiated with a list of Player names, and an int indicating the number of decks to be used.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> names, int decks)
      Game is constructed with a list of player names, and the number of decks to be used.

      • turn

        public void turn()
        Sets the last turned card as the second last turned card. Takes a card from the player whose turn it is and adds it to the communal pile, setting it as the last turned card. Checks if any players have lost (have no more cards) after that action and if the game is over (only one player left).

      • setTopCard

        public void setTopCard(Card c)

      • getLastCard

        public Card getLastCard()
        Gets the second last turned card of the communal pile
        Returns:
        Card object

      • snap

        public boolean snap(Player p)
        Checks if the snap provoked by Player p is valid. If it is, player p receives the cards contained in the communal pile. Else, the cards in the communal pile are distributed to all other players still in the game. It returns a boolean indicating whether snap was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        p - Player Object
        Returns:
        boolean
